description.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity to deliver integrated social protection services, including goods and cash, to the most deprived families, as well as in support of families, including children on the move, during acute emergency and recovery, in line with the CCCs.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2021 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Afghanistan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Afghanistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity to deliver integrated social protection services, including goods and cash, to the most deprived families, as well as in support of families, including children on the move, during acute emergency and recovery, in line with the CCCs.

description.narrative: Support was provided to vulnerable children and their families through social protection interventions during the pandemic | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/07/2020

title.narrative: 2.1 Evidence: Existence of data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (such as health, education, nutrition etc...)

target.value: 2021:Data exists on the impact of social protection on child marriage and school enrolment

title.narrative: Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

baseline.value: Draft overarching Social Policy in place

target.value: 2021:Draft national social protection strategy/roadmap in place

actual.value: 2020:Ongoing - Stakeholder's analysis, Need-based assessment and Social Protection Mapping developed, feedback received from MoLSA and is awaiting review of Ministry of MoMD. After finalisation of these documents, the development of the national social protection policy can start.

title.narrative: 2.16 Shock-responsive SP: Standalone/ parallel humanitarian cash transfers are designed and facilitated to strengthen and/or transition into existing SP systems

target.value: 2021:One standalone humanitarian cash transfer system in place with a design that will facilitate transitioning into existing SP system
